decks.notes: The deck focuses on deploying threats quickly and efficiently while disrupting the opponent with counterspells and removal. It aims to apply pressure early on with aggressive creatures like Murktide Regent and Dragon's Rage Channeler, backed up by versatile spells such as Lightning Bolt and Daze. The deck also features card draw and filtering to maintain card advantage and find key pieces. The mana base is optimized for consistency and allows for both aggressive plays and disruption through cards like Wasteland.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature plays and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. Utilizing powerful creatures like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Guide of Souls, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast tempo and strong board presence. Cards like Swords to Plowshares and Goblin Bombardment provide removal and direct damage, while lands like Plateau and Karakas ensure mana stability. The inclusion of cards like Static Prison and Voice of Victory also add disruption and additional win conditions to the deck's arsenal.

This Dimir Tempo deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while quickly establishing board presence and overwhelming them with aggressive creatures. By utilizing a combination of hand disruption spells, counterspells, and removal, the deck aims to control the game tempo and protect its threats. Cards like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Fatal Push help to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent provide powerful threats that can quickly close out the game. The deck also includes card draw and deck manipulation spells to ensure consistency in drawing the necessary cards to maintain pressure.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures, such as Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, using cards like Entomb and Reanimate. This allows the player to bring these creatures back onto the battlefield for a cheap cost and overpower their opponent. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to control the game and protect the combo. With a mix of efficient creatures and control elements, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game with powerful reanimated threats.

The deck aims to assemble the combo of Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to mill the library, followed by using Dread Return to reanimate Thassa's Oracle for a win by decking out the opponent. The deck also includes counterspells, card draw, and tutors to protect and find pieces of the combo. Urza's Saga provides additional utility and Cavern of Souls helps to protect key creatures from counterspells. The deck is focused on efficiently and quickly executing the combo while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The main idea of this deck is to assemble the pieces needed to utilize the Coveted Jewel artifact and generate a powerful advantage. The deck includes cards like Paradox Engine and Trinisphere to control the game, as well as cards like Show and Tell and Transmute Artifact to find and play Coveted Jewel. The win condition of the deck is to generate a large amount of mana using untapping effects like Grim Monolith and Manifold Key, ultimately leading to a game-winning play or overwhelming advantage through the power of Coveted Jewel.

The deck aims to quickly and efficiently cycle through the entire library to win the game with only spells and no lands. By sacrificing creatures, using mana acceleration, and powerful combo pieces, the deck seeks to set up a quick and devastating win condition. The deck includes a variety of cards that enable the combo, protect it with counterspells, and disrupt opponents' strategies. With the right draws and plays, the deck can overwhelm opponents before they have a chance to react, making it a high-risk, high-reward strategy in Legacy 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on using cards like Painter's Servant, Grindstone, and Goblin Welder to create a powerful combo that can quickly win the game by milling the opponent's library. It also includes ways to protect the combo with cards like Pyroblast and Red Elemental Blast, while using fast mana sources like Simian Spirit Guide and Ancient Tomb to accelerate the strategy. The inclusion of cards like Phyrexian Dragon Engine and Chaos Defiler provide alternative win conditions, making the deck versatile and difficult for opponents to deal with.

This deck aims to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Ancient Tomb and Grim Monolith, while utilizing Show and Tell and Transmute Artifact to bring out powerful combo pieces like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and The One Ring. It also includes removal in the form of Sink into Stupor and Force of Will to control the board. The main win condition is to assemble Coveted Jewel along with The One Ring to generate massive advantage and overwhelm the opponent. The deck has a strong focus on combo plays and resource manipulation to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo involving Paradox Engine, Aetherflux Reservoir, and various artifacts to generate infinite mana, draw cards, and gain life to ultimately finish with an explosive Aetherflux Reservoir activation. The deck includes a mix of artifact ramp, card draw, and disruption spells to facilitate the combo and protect it from being disrupted. Emry, Lurker of the Loch serves as a key piece in recurring artifacts from the graveyard, while Urza's Saga provides additional utility and tutoring for crucial artifacts. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with its sheer power and synergy.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly and efficiently get powerful creatures into the graveyard using cards like Entomb and Unmask, and then bring them back into play with Animate Dead and Reanimate. This allows for explosive plays with creatures like Griselbrand and Archon of Cruelty, overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats. The deck also includes disruption in the form of discard spells like Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to combo off and reanimate big threats to win the game.

The deck revolves around using artifacts to generate mana and combo off using Mystic Forge to play through the deck quickly and assemble a win condition. The deck includes ways to untap artifacts for added value and uses powerful artifacts like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storms for additional control and utility. The goal is to quickly assemble key pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of fast mana acceleration and powerful card advantage engines.

The deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with aggressive creatures like Broadside Bombardiers and Seasoned Dungeoneer, supported by ramp spells such as Lotus Petal and Simian Spirit Guide. It aims to control the game with disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Cavern of Souls while maintaining the initiative with cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Fury. The deck prioritizes speed and efficiency, utilizing fast mana sources like Ancient Tomb and City of Traitors to power out threats early on.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of hand disruption, removal spells, and card advantage to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By utilizing cards like Thoughtseize, Fatal Push, and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also generating value with cards like Brainstorm and Murktide Regent, the deck aims to outlast and outgrind the opponent until it can secure a victory. The deck's mana base also includes Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base and gain further advantage.
